docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Backup Exercises

Depending on the programme of study and how much time we can assign to this, these notes give examples of different scenarios we need to know to operate an infrastructure.

docs.title: Active Directory
docs.text:
You have a domain controller which you previously created for Electric-Petrol. Using Server Manager, install Windows Server Backup.

Fig 1. Add Roles and Features.

Under Server Manager->Tools, run Windows Server Backup. Select Local Backup and then Backup Once

Under Server Manager->Tools, run Windows Server Backup. Select Local Backup and then Backup Once.

Fig 2. Local backup.

Select Different Options and Click Next.

Fig 3. Options.

Select Backup Configuration, select Custom

Fig 4. Backup Configuration.

Under Select Items, Click Add, select System State and click OK.

Fig 5. System State.

Select Advanced Settings and the select VSS Settings. Enable VSS Full Backup, so that you get a valid backup, even if a change is being made to the directory during the backup.

Fig 6. VSS.

Click Next. You should store your backup on a remote shared folder or a dedicated backup disk. In this case, I'm just using C:. Click Next.

Fig 7. Destination.
